term.title: polygranular carbon

item.text: A carbon material composed of grains, which can be clearly distinguished by means of optical microscopy.

notes.item: Industrial carbon materials (such as electrodes) are mostly polygranular, but special grades are agranular materials, such as glass-like carbon, carbon fibres or pyrolytic carbon. Such materials are covered by the term agranular carbon.

sources.item: PAC, 1995, 67, 473. 'Recommended terminology for the description of carbon as a solid (IUPAC Recommendations 1995)' on page 501 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199567030473)
